definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: Love comes to man through his senses , to woman through her imagination.
sentences.chinese: 男人靠触感来启发爱意，女人透过想像感受情爱。

sentences.english: The second part is of the concept of love in the Jin Yunqiao Biography.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分主要探讨《金云翘传》中的情爱观。

sentences.english: Li Jeren s love narrative is full of idealism and myth colors.
sentences.chinese: 李人的情爱叙事具有理想的色彩和“神话”品格。

sentences.english: Whatever the reality or reason, ultimately, to the largest number of human beings, or love.
sentences.chinese: 无论现实还是理智，人类最终需要最多的，还是情爱。

sentences.english: They are all dissociating the ordinary love and belong to men's sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 他们都游离于凡间的情爱之中，都归宿于男人的情怀。

sentences.english: Sexual expression is more than erotic pleasure or sexual acts.
sentences.chinese: 性表达不止是情爱乐趣和性行为。

sentences.english: Pondering on Love is an expression of love poems on men and women.
sentences.chinese: 《有所思》是一首表达男女情爱的诗。

sentences.english: Nothing but love that shows my Lord to me!
Myth has it that oysters arethe food of love. Science may agree.
sentences.chinese: 相传牡蛎是情爱之食，科学家对此表示认同。

sentences.english: This study discusses love writing and reading for "Ancient China Brothel" during the late Wan-Li of the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 本篇论文以万历后期青楼的情爱书写与阅读为中心。

sentences.english: But the biggest change it has made is in my relationship.
sentences.chinese: 但是它带来的最大的改变是在我的情爱关系中。

sentences.english: It may be that love is beautiful with all its foolishness.
sentences.chinese: 也许，情爱之事虽不乏愚蠢，却是美不堪言。

definition: in love with/to feel deeply attached to
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
affection/family love/love, esp. within a married couple or between parents and children
emotion/sentiment/affection/feelings between two persons/CL:個|个[ge4],種|种[zhong3]
